# War Memorial Building (Jackson, Mississippi)

| locmapin = Mississippi#USA
| built = 1939-1940
| architect=E.L. Malvaney, principal architect
| builder =M. T. Reed Construction Company, W. J. McGee and Son
| designated_nrhp_type = November 25, 1969
| partof=Capitol Green
| partof_refnum = 69000083
}}
The War Memorial Building is a historic building in Jackson, Mississippi, U.S.. It was designed by architect Edgar Lucian Malvaney, and built in 1939â€“1940. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places as a contributing property in the Capitol Green since November 25, 1969.
Sculptor Albert Rieker designed two friezes on the building.
